definition: money for a voyage/travel expenses
to twine/to coil

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy

sentences.english: See ya tomorrow hey Frank can I borrow a couple of bucks from you?
sentences.chinese: 明天見了，嘿法蘭克我能不能跟你借點盤纏用用？

sentences.english: He was found desperately trying to untangle several reels of film.
sentences.chinese: 他被撞見拼命想要解開幾盤纏在一起的膠捲。

sentences.english: Face, send that person many travelling expenses again.
sentences.chinese: 臨走，又送那人不少盤纏。

sentences.english: The sailor coiled the rope around the anchor.
sentences.chinese: 水手把繩子盤纏在錨上。

definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
tip/gratuity/monetary reward/bonus
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to scrutinize/to examine/to check
to drown one's sorrows (in alcohol)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
long-cherished wish
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to sign/to make one's mark
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to squander money/to spend extravagantly
